Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: @Alright "Sorry, what I mean is that wide spread adoption of it is a fantasy." Why?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: If it is widely adopted, it will be regulated to all hell. Imagine any large corp setting up payment channels. Do you think they'll allow just anyone to pay them or will they use services that introduce KYC?

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: "blockstream took something that was entirely viable and undermined it entirely in favor of lightning network which is arguably a centralized system" You can say Lightning is centralized, but still trustless. Centralization is the only way to achieve scalable blockchains, but the important part is BTC is the arbitrator if there's a dispute, so it's still trustless.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `Centralization is the only way to achieve scalable blockchains` Are you aware of KMD's scaling efforts?

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: You don't have to use payment channels that require KYC. If there is economic need for no KYC, it will be so. Crypto is pure economics.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: My biggest problem with Lightning is that some middle man can say "we won't let you pay this corp". Surely the corp won't open payment channels with just anyone

Author: Alright#0419
Content: You will have to use payment channels that require KYC if it is widely adopted

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: "`Centralization is the only way to achieve scalable blockchains` Are you aware of KMD's scaling efforts?" No, that's why I asked how Komodo will use side channels. I don't see how you scale without side channels. If you're writing things to multiple places, that's going to be less efficient than writing to one place.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: What do you mean by side channels?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: We have a fungible chain solution that allows for near linear scaling

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You just use more blockchains (or larger blocks) depending on the use case.

Content: #kmdice  has a cluster of chains that you can send coins between. I did 100,000+ migrate transacion my self in the last few days alone.
